article.headline: VCU 82, The Citadel 59
article.story: RICHMOND, Va. -- T.J. Gwynn came off the bench to score 20 points as Virginia Commonwealth opened its season with an 82-59 win over The Citadel Sunday in the Cancun Challenge. Gwynn hit all eight of his field-goal attempts. After the Bulldogs (1-1) ran off the first six points of the game, VCU scored 14 straight, six by Gwynn. The Rams led by as many as 17 points after Brandon Rozzell?s 3-pointer pushed the margin to 42-25 with 39.5 seconds left in the first half. The Rams extended the margin to 26 points in the second half, maintaining a double-digit lead the entire period. VCU finished with 29 points off 22 turnovers by The Citadel. Eric Maynor added 12 points and seven assists for the Rams. Ed Nixon had a career-high 11 points and Joey Rodriguez added 10. Austin Dahn led The Citadel with 13 points and Cameron Wells added 11.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
